info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 4 at 2:21PM EDT until April 6 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding of rivers and creeks is possible across the region. Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is also possible, mainly overnight tonight and early Saturday.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Geauga and Portage.
* WHEN...Through Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Conditions are saturated with streams and creeks running high after heavy rain Wednesday into Thursday. Another round of rain and thunderstorms is expected overnight tonight into early Saturday, producing 1.00 to 2.00 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible. Rain will then continue at times through early Sunday, which could lead to continued river rises. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
